data.title: List of supercentenarians born in Austria-Hungary
data.meta_description: This list includes supercentenarians (people who have attained the age of at least 110 years) and foreign supercentenarians who were born in the historical state of Austria-Hungary. Austria-Hungary was an multi-national country, located in Central Europe. It was a constitutional union of the...
data.text:
This list includes supercentenarians (people who have attained the age of at least 110 years) and foreign supercentenarians who were born in the historical state of Austria-Hungary.

Austria-Hungary was an multi-national country, located in Central Europe. It was a constitutional union of the Empire of Austria and the Apostolic Kingdom of Hungary that existed from 1867 to 1918 and it consisted of many different nations, speaking their native languages - German, Hungarian, Czech, Polish, Ukrainian, Slovak, Slovenian, Croatian, Serbian, Italian and Romanian. Austria-Hungary was a multinational realm and also one of the world's great powers. Austria-Hungary was geographically the second-largest country in Europe after the Russian Empire, at 621,538 km2 (239,977 sq mi), and the third-most populous (after Russian Empire and the German Empire). The Austro-Hungarian state ceased to exist in 1918, after the lost World War I, and its disintegration gave rise to new countries existing today in these areas: Austria, Hungary, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina and also parts of today Poland, Ukraine, Italy, Serbia, Montenegro and Romania.

There have been verified 38 supercentenarians born in the historical state of Austria-Hungary. Another 10 supercentenarians are currently pending. The verified supercentenarians were born in today Austria, Poland, Czech Republic, Slovenia, Croatia and Hungary. What is more, there are pending supercentenarians born in Ukraine. This list also features unvalidated supercentenarians whose ages are probably true. As for the present day, there are no verified supercentenarians born in the modern borders of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro and Serbia, but there is one pending case in Slovakia.

The oldest person ever born in the historical state of Austria-Hungary is Tekla Juniewicz (1906-2022) of Poland, aged 118 years, 68 days. The oldest known male born in the Austro-Hungarian Empire was Jerzy Pajaczkowski-Dydynski (1894-2005), aged 111 years, 140 days. [1]

Supercentenarians born in today Austria

Austria is the main successor of Austria-Hungary and is located in the western part of the historical state. There have been 6 verified supercentenarians born in the Austrian part of Austria-Hungary and 1 known supercentenarian is currently pending.

Deceased (Verified) Living (Verified) Pending

Supercentenarians born in today Hungary

Hungary is the second main successor of Austria-Hungary, though after the Treaty of Trianon, it has lost the considerable part of its previous territory. Hungary is located in the central part of the historical state of Austria-Hungary. There has been 1 verified supercentenarian born in Hungarian part of Austria-Hungary and one, who is currently pending.

Deceased (Verified) Living (Verified) Pending

Rank Name Sex Birth date Death date Age County

of birth County or country

of death 1 Elizabeth Stefan F 13 May 1895 9 Apr 2008 112 years, 332 days Szabolcsveresmart United States (Connecticut) 2 Helen Obermayer F 20 Jan 1878 20 Nov 1991 112 years, 304 days Bakonybél United States (Florida) 3 Gallai Rezső M 29 Jan 1904 25 Sep 2014 110 years, 239 days Vas Hungary (Győr-Moson-Sopron) 4 Rozalia Foldes F 18 Jan 1894 22 Jul 2004 110 years, 186 days Hungary Hungary

a^ Gallai was born in Szombathely, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in Hungary.

Supercentenarians born in today Czech Republic

Czech Republic is located in the north-western part of historical state of Austria-Hungary. As well as in the case of Austria and Hungary, the whole modern territory of today Czech Republic was included in Austria-Hungary. In 1918, after the disintegration of the historical state, the new state, which erupted in the territory of today Czech Republic was called Czechoslovakia and apart from the territory of today Czech Republic, it also included the modern territory of Slovakia. Czechoslovakia existed until 1993, when it split into Czech Republic and Slovakia. There have been 7 verified supercentenarians born in Czech part of Austria-Hungary.

Deceased (Verified) Living (Verified) Pending

Rank Name Sex Birth date Death date Age County of birth County or country of death 1 Maria Mika F 23 May 1882 17 Nov 1994 112 years, 178 days Bohemia Austria 2 Dr. Edith Kaufmann F 12 Dec 1903 7 Oct 2015 111 years, 299 days Ústí nad Labem United Kingdom 3 Marie Bernatkova F 22 Oct 1857 4 May 1969 111 years, 194 days Prague Zlín 4 Anna Stephan F 25 Mar 1892 3 Aug 2003 111 years, 131 days Bohemia Germany 5 Aloysia Tilscher F 9 Dec 1893 8 Nov 2004 110 years, 335 days Moravia Germany 6 Alice Herz-Sommer F 26 Nov 1903 23 Feb 2014 110 years, 89 days Prague United Kingdom 7 Franziska Maier F 23 Apr 1898 20 May 2008 110 years, 27 days Bohemia Germany

a^ Mika was born in Bohemia, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in the Czech Republic.

b^ Kauffmann was born in Děčín, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in the Czech Republic.

c^ Bernatkova was born in Prague, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. She died in the Zlín Region, which was then part of Czechoslovakia. Both are now in the Czech Republic.

d^ Stephan was born in Bohemia, which was then part of the Austrian part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in the Czech Republic.

e^ Tilscher was born in Moravia, which was then part of the Austrian part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in the Czech Republic.

f^ Herz-Sommer was born in Prague, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in the Czech Republic.

g^ Maier was born in Bohemia, which was then part of the Austrian part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in the Czech Republic.

Supercentenarians born in today Slovakia

Slovakia has been in whole included in Austria-Hungary's territory. It is located in the north-western part of the historical state. Slovakia was part of Czechoslovakia until 1993, when it split into Czech Republic and Slovakia. There has been 1 pending supercentenarian born in Slovakian part of Austria-Hungary.

Deceased (Verified) Living (Verified) Pending

Rank Name Sex Birth date Death date Age County of birth County or country of death 1 Maria Brandes F 11 Aug 1902 6 Feb 2013 110 years, 179 days Trnava Bavaria, Germany

a^ Brandes was born in Trnava, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in Slovakia.

Supercentenarians born in today Slovenia

Slovenia has been in whole included in Austria-Hungary's territory. It is located in the south-western part of the historical state. Since 1918, Slovenia has been part of the Kingdom of Serbs, Croatians and Slovenians (later Kingdom of Yugoslavia). In 1991, Slovenia proclamated its independence. In 2004, Slovenia became part of the European Union. There has been 1 verified supercentenarian born in Slovenian part of Austria-Hungary.

Deceased (Verified) Living (Verified) Pending

Rank Name Sex Birth date Death date Age County of birth County or country of death 1 Katarina Marinič F 30 Oct 1899 2 Sep 2010 110 years, 307 days Slovene Littoral Slovenia (Slovene Littoral) 2 Niko Dragos M 27 Aug 1907 31 Mar 2018 110 years, 216 days White Carniola Central Slovenia

a^ Marinič was born in Deskle, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in Slovenia.

Supercentenarians born in today Croatia

Croatia is located in the southern part of the historical Austria-Hungary. Its today territory has been completely included in the former Austro-Hungarian borders. Croatia, together with Slovenia, became part of Kingdom of Yugoslavia and proclamated independence in 1991. In 2013, Croatia became part of the European Union. There has been 1 verified supercentenarian born in the Croatian part of Austria-Hungary.

Deceased (verified) Living (verified) Pending

Rank Name Sex Birth date Death date Age State or country of birth State of death 1 Hermina Dunz F 24 Feb 1898 14 Jun 2008 110 years, 111 days Croatia Austria (Styria)

a^ Dunz was born in Zagreb, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in Croatia.

Supercentenarians born in today Italy

Parts of Northern Italy were in possession of Austria-Hungary. They were the territories of South Tyrol (Alto Adige in Italian), Trentino, part of Province of Belluno, a small part of Friuli and Western part of Venezia Giulia. There have been 7 known supercentenarians born in Italian part of Austria-Hungary: 4 are verified, 2 still pending, and 1 is unvalidated.

Deceased (Verified) Living (Verified) Pending

Rank Name Sex Birth date Death date Age Region of birth Region or country of death 1 Venere Pizzinato-Papo F 23 Nov 1896 2 Aug 2011 114 years, 252 days Trentino-Alto Adige Italy (Veneto) 2 Theresia Staffler-Breitenberger F 15 Nov 1898 11 Jan 2010 111 years, 57 days Trentino-Alto Adige Italy (Trentino-Alto Adige) Maria Cavalli [2] F 13 Dec 1910 13 Jan 2022 111 years, 31 days Friuli-Venezia Giulia Italy (Friuli-Venezia Giulia) Rosina Nicolli F 12 Mar 1904 10 Dec 2014 110 years, 273 days Trentino-Alto Adige Italy (Trentino-Alto Adige) 3 Liduina Dalrì F 15 Sep 1892 25 Dec 2002 110 years, 101 days Trentino-Alto Adige Italy (Trentino-Alto Adige) 4 Elda Cattoni F 20 Jul 1901 9 Aug 2011 110 years, 20 days Trentino-Alto Adige Italy (Trentino-Alto Adige) 5 Carmela Urizzi-Callede F 29 Sep 1903 1 Oct 2013 110 years, 2 days Friuli-Venezia Giulia France

f^ Cattoni was born in Riva del Garda, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in Italy.

g^ Urizzi-Callede was born in Visco, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in Italy.

Supercentenarians born in today Poland

The southernmost part of Poland has been in possession of Austria-Hungary since the Partitions of Poland, in which Austrian Empire (later Austria-Hungary) took part in 1772 and in 1795, together with Russian Empire and Kingdom of Prussia (later part of German Empire). It was the western territory of Galicia, today Polish Voivodeships: Lesser Poland and Subcarpathia, located in the northernmost part of the historical state of Austria-Hungary. Poland regained independence on November 11, 1918 and the Austro-Hungarian part of Poland became then part of independent Second Polish Republic. Since 1945, its eastern part, including the city of Lwów and Polish historical Voivodeships: Lwów Voivodship, Tarnopol Voivodship, Volhynia Voivodship and Stanisławów Voivodship, has been part of Soviet Union and since 1991 it is part of independent Ukraine. There have been 5 verified supercentenarians born in Polish part of Austria-Hungary and 1 known supercentenarian is currently pending.

Deceased (Verified) Living (Verified) Pending

d^ Lewicki was born in Borysławka, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in Poland.

e^ Dranka was born in Harklowa, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in Poland.

f^ Gawlowska was born in Cieszyn, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now (partially) in Poland.

Supercentenarians born in today Serbia

Parts of Northern Serbia were in possession of Austria-Hungary. They were the territories of Vojvodina in northern Serbia. In 1918 after WW1 it was annexed in Serbia. Later Serbia became part of Yugoslavia until 2003. There are no verified supercentenarians yet born in Serbian part of Austria-Hungary but there is one case that might be true.

Deceased (Verified) Living (Verified) Pending

Rank Name Sex Birth date Death date Age Voivodeship of birth Voivodeship of death 1 Veronika Zsilinszki F 4 Feb 1908 20 Apr 2021 113 years, 75 days Kovin Hungary

a^ Zsilinszki was born in Kevevara, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in Serbia.

Supercentenarians born in today Ukraine

The westernmost part of today Ukraine was in possession of Austria-Hungary. In 1918, the whole region of Galicia became part of Second Polish Republic, independent Poland with Lwów as the most important, capital city of the region. However, after the World War II, the eastern part of Gallicia including Polish historical eastern Voivodeships: Lwów Voivodship, Tarnopol Voivodship, Volhynia Voivodship and Stanisławów Voivodship became part of Soviet Union. In 1991, the region became part of independent Ukraine. The eastern Gallicia has been located in the north-eastern part of Austria-Hungary. There have been three known supercentenarians, who have been born in Ukrainian part of Austria-Hungary.

Deceased (Verified) Living (Verified) Pending

Rank Name Sex Birth date Death date Age Voivodeship of birth Voivodeship of death 1 Tekla Juniewicz F 10 June 1906 19 Aug 2022 116 years, 70 days Lwow Poland (Silesia) 2 Wanda Wierzchleyska F 3 Mar 1900 14 Jan 2012 111 years, 317 days Lwow Poland (Masovia) 3 Jerzy Pajaczkowski-Dydynski M 19 Jul 1894 6 Dec 2005 111 years, 140 days Lwow United Kingdom

a^ Wierzchleyska was born in Lwów, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. Later it became part of Poland and it is now in Ukraine.

b^ Pajączkowski-Dydyński was born in Lwów, which was then part of Austria-Hungary. Later, it was part of Poland, and it is now in Ukraine.

Supercentenarians born in today Romania

Transylvania, eastern Banat, Crișana, southern Maramureș and southern Bukovina were part of Austria-Hungary and were integrated into Romania after World War I. There have been 1 verified supercentenarian born in the Romanian part of Austria-Hungary.

Deceased (Verified) Living (Verified) Pending

Rank Name Sex Birth date Death date Age Region of birth Region or country of death 1 Maria Corba F 15 Aug 1878 8 Mar 1989 110 years, 205 days Banat Germany (North Rhine-Westphalia)

a^ Corba was born in Izgar, which was then part of the Hungarian part of Austria-Hungary. It is now in Romania.
